positive.review:
Do not fall for the Peggle or PvZ propaganda. 

Zuma is THE PopCap game of all time.
I love this game, from the funky music to the pseudo-south American theme.  It remains challenging and fun despite the many times I have played it!!

a game for uncs and people with a lot of patience. don't be fooled by the colorful baby sensory video balls and silly-looking frog, this game has a deceptively high skill ceiling and some straight up diabolical levels. your willpower and sanity is going to be tested by this game, and you will either crack under the pressure or emerge stronger than ever before.

this game is pretty simple if you can count to 3 and know how to tell colors apart then you can play the game. there isn't much else to it other than match the balls until the level ends

another banger from old popcap, 10/10
this game is supper soothing after a day of work and helps me relax enough so i can sleep
This game is really exciting and fun. I like the coloured balls and the birds.

O melhor jogo j√° feito de todos os tempos.

Gameplay cativante, desafiadora e extremamente divertida, a m√∫sica ent√£o nem se fala, t√£o boa que s√≥ tem uma trilha de jogo.

Hist√≥ria cheia de emo√ß√£o e tem√°ticas fortes, mostrando que at√© mesmo se voc√™ for um sapo, voc√™ pode lutar. Mal posso esperar pelo live action.
Simply fun. One of the most simple match 3 games. The game runs smooth, the balls are big, nice art and level design.
I refuse to lie in the face of defeat of the matching game I couldn't beat at the age of 4

0.99 euros well spend for the sake of my nostalgia. Cheers.

It's weird writing this from this account, but going through my mom's stuff and seeing her play time made me feel compelled to write it. There was this one level that she always struggled on, I'm not sure which one, but she kept trying at it over and over again. She passed away from a previously diagnosed cancer recently, but it was kind of amazing loggin on to her laptop to find any personal documents we would need for her final affairs and seeing she had this many hours on this game. Goes to show how good of a formula this sort of puzzle game had.

Rest well, Angela. Fuck cancer.

Used to play this a lot in my childhood. Glad to have it on Steam so I can do it all over again. My grandma also plays this and she's still got it. It's like a match 3 game but actually interesting because the balls are moving. This is technology discovered by cavemen and I'm glad it's put to good use.
Amazing game, saw my mom play it when I was little, now Im the one playing it and its so fun, too bad there are still a few optimization lags but that's okay.
Zuma is a fantastic escape from reality. I've played this game since the dawn of time and will keep doing so because it is the greatest experience of all time.
i used to play this as a kid and once i found it again and started to play it again it felt like back in the day good times good game to play to love it
Simple but engaging casual game. Works well on Linux.
I love this game, from the funky music to the pseudo-south American theme.  It remains challenging and fun despite the many times I have played it!!
it is a game I have enjoyed for many years.  It is a game that sharpens sight, hand movement while looking ahead.  No commercials.  You can check back every  so often or steadily to check astuteness.

Do not fall for the Peggle or PvZ propaganda. 

Zuma is THE PopCap game of all time.
this game is really addicting and nostalgic, worth the purchase
This game is really exciting and fun. I like the coloured balls and the birds.

a game for uncs and people with a lot of patience. don't be fooled by the colorful baby sensory video balls and silly-looking frog, this game has a deceptively high skill ceiling and some straight up diabolical levels. your willpower and sanity is going to be tested by this game, and you will either crack under the pressure or emerge stronger than ever before.

this game is pretty simple if you can count to 3 and know how to tell colors apart then you can play the game. there isn't much else to it other than match the balls until the level ends

another banger from old popcap, 10/10

We're going back to the gaming parents/grandparents era with this one!

Zuma is a match-3 bubble-shooting game made by PopCap in 2003. It's a small yet addicting game that  definitely had its concept not stolen from a Japanese company.

Your objective in Zuma is to clear all of the marbles on the way before they reach the skull (or two) and become the Sun God.
Playing as that frog, you can find sorts of power-ups that will help do your job easier. You can also find coins, create gaps, combos and chains in order to finish the level.
There is also Gauntlet Mode, a practice and a survival mode aimed to test your Zumaic skills. Think you can make it to Sun God 10?
I also love the artstyle it uses. Good gracious how beautiful it is!

My criticisms when it comes to this game is how repetitive the music is; I swear I had to listen to the full song sometimes during Jaguar/Sun God levels since they're too long. For difficulty, it's a bit balanced but I have to say, it is harder than Zuma's Revenge (a bit closer to Heroic Frog).
Not only that but the game can be often boring if you have nothing to do, especially if it's your only game.

Conclusion:
Zuma Deluxe is a good casual game if you're into old times. It's still solid to this day but I recommend its sequel if you want more content. The choice is yours tho.

Final Rating: 7/10
This game is super hard for someone that was held back in kindergarten, like my friend.
16 hours in and i still havent beaten the game, the frog taunts me
I just love how you can get into the zone with this game. The boosters are fun. I appreciate that it has an end point, too.
A timeless classic. I used to watch my mother play this when I was a small child.
classic game that knows what it is and does not add flashy nonsense

Ridiculously exhilarating game, especially if you know what you're doing. Every design element lends itself to selling tension - the typical result of beating a stage is releasing a breath you didn't realize you were holding in. Get a good mouse and go nuts.
Been playing since 2009, it never gets old or boring to me. Timeless one of a kind. My favorite game of all time. Always fun, always relaxing, always challenging on various levels.

[h1] When we were young - Ruki Vverh! (and when our parents got into it) [/h1]

Zuma Deluxe is a fucking classic! The main levels fly by in one go, giving you the feeling of an easy victory, but do not relax ‚Äì the game skillfully throws up a kind of challenge, forcing you to strain your attention and reaction. Yes, the gameplay sorely lacks variety and twists of the levels for balls and various bonuses (for example, as in Luxor 2005), which could add depth to the gameplay. But! These shortcomings can be forgiven, because here is the quintessence of classics, time-tested. There is magic in its simplicity that makes you come back again and again. Well, what else can I say? RIBBIT!

When I first beheld this strange idol, a stone frog of unspeakable antiquity, I knew I was gazing into the residue of barbarous peoples whose rituals mocked the higher faculties of man. The spheres that tumble forth are no mere ornaments of color but the very relics of a degenerate Aztec pageant, a carnival of chaos born of crude sacrifice and primitive awe.

And yet, as I set myself to the task of firing one orb into the next, I felt the thrill of dominion over that lesser heritage. What the Aztecs could never master, I dispatched with a steady hand and a mind sharpened by discipline. To them, it was frenzied blood and stone; to me, it is geometry, rhythm, and the sweet song of inevitability as their sacred marbles shatter in ordered succession.

Zuma Deluxe thus becomes an unintentional comedy: the trappings of fallen civilizations preserved in pixels, only to be neatly subdued by the modern player who bends their savage art into a pastime of precision. The game is simple, hypnotic, and entirely delightful, though I cannot play without smirking at the thought of those long-vanquished builders of temples watching their legacy reduced to a frog spitting marbles.

negative.review:
Hi everyone, I need some help with Zuma Deluxe (Steam version).
I have color vision deficiency and I can‚Äôt distinguish between blue and purple, or yellow and green.
I‚Äôm looking for a color-blind friendly mod or a custom sphere set that replaces these colors with more distinct ones (for example: orange/pink instead of blue/purple).
If anyone knows a working mod or has a download link that is compatible with the Steam version, please let me know.
Thanks in advance!
It doesn't run in full-screen mode, I tried all the solutions I could find online. And as I see they haven't fixed this problem in years.

I used to have this installed on my PC 20 years ago. Back then I didn't understand any game rules so I wasn't able to pass even 1st stage.
Now I passed mutiple levels and just got bored.
It should be free to play in 2025

let me get things straight, i played this game before i got it here on steam. Good and simple game design, good game doesn't need to be complicated. Level design, stunning and iconic. you will still remember it a decade later. although, I've been playing for over 2 hrs and I already noticed some problems that you won't really notice in the first few levels.

1. User Experience does not meet up to what the game is.

you can't have a good gameplay flow without a good UX even when your game design is brilliant. The pace off how you shoot the ball is a bit too slow for it to get exactly where its supposed to get. the movement of the balls in the "alley" are too jerky in speed that is a bit hard to predict. This is more noticeable in a few levels in, causing you to place the ball in the wrong slot when it gets tighter. 

2. Some parts of the level map is a bit harder to distinguish when trying to place the ball, it is hard to tell the separation of the overlapping lanes when its crucial. 

well to be fair, I do not remember Zuma to have these problems, it could be that it is just this version on steam. It has been a while since I last played it. Came back to play for User Experience module in university.

would be better if there was a difficulty slider.... how am i supposed to know where to shoot??? if there was a little yellow paint to give me some direction it'd be more fun.....also there isnt any cultural diversity in the main cast of the game....not sure how i feel about that.....game also could use a handicapped accessibility option in the settings not everybody has the strength to press right mouse button so much after the first level my entire hand was shaking and i could barely breathe so unfortunately for me this game is a 2,6/8
Game won't load full screen. Only can play in a size of a pack of cards.

Hi everyone, I need some help with Zuma Deluxe (Steam version).
I have color vision deficiency and I can‚Äôt distinguish between blue and purple, or yellow and green.
I‚Äôm looking for a color-blind friendly mod or a custom sphere set that replaces these colors with more distinct ones (for example: orange/pink instead of blue/purple).
If anyone knows a working mod or has a download link that is compatible with the Steam version, please let me know.
Thanks in advance!

let me get things straight, i played this game before i got it here on steam. Good and simple game design, good game doesn't need to be complicated. Level design, stunning and iconic. you will still remember it a decade later. although, I've been playing for over 2 hrs and I already noticed some problems that you won't really notice in the first few levels.

1. User Experience does not meet up to what the game is.

you can't have a good gameplay flow without a good UX even when your game design is brilliant. The pace off how you shoot the ball is a bit too slow for it to get exactly where its supposed to get. the movement of the balls in the "alley" are too jerky in speed that is a bit hard to predict. This is more noticeable in a few levels in, causing you to place the ball in the wrong slot when it gets tighter. 

2. Some parts of the level map is a bit harder to distinguish when trying to place the ball, it is hard to tell the separation of the overlapping lanes when its crucial. 

well to be fair, I do not remember Zuma to have these problems, it could be that it is just this version on steam. It has been a while since I last played it. Came back to play for User Experience module in university.

I used to have this installed on my PC 20 years ago. Back then I didn't understand any game rules so I wasn't able to pass even 1st stage.
Now I passed mutiple levels and just got bored.
It should be free to play in 2025

would be better if there was a difficulty slider.... how am i supposed to know where to shoot??? if there was a little yellow paint to give me some direction it'd be more fun.....also there isnt any cultural diversity in the main cast of the game....not sure how i feel about that.....game also could use a handicapped accessibility option in the settings not everybody has the strength to press right mouse button so much after the first level my entire hand was shaking and i could barely breathe so unfortunately for me this game is a 2,6/8
It doesn't run in full-screen mode, I tried all the solutions I could find online. And as I see they haven't fixed this problem in years.
Game won't load full screen. Only can play in a size of a pack of cards.
